title: American_Top_40_1976_December_4th
description:
"Every week on American Top 40, based on Billboard's national statistics of record sales and radio station airplay, we count down the most popular songs in the Nation. Now, at number eight, moving up one, it's Boston with 'More Than A Feeling'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

The first single from Stevie Wonder's new album (which debuted at number one on the album chart) debuts on the hot 100 all the way up at number 40!

John Travolta in on the chart (at number 38) with his SECOND top 40 hit.

A listener wants to know, "In the rock era, which album by a female singer has occupied the number one spot for the most weeks?" Casey tells us about the top two.

Another listener wants to know if there has ever been a top 40 hit that wasn't a vocal, instrumental, or spoken word performance? Casey says there were two, and they were completely different types of performances.

Casey reveals what group has had the most chart albums. This group put 36 albums on the Billboard chart in 12 years, and it wasn't the Beatles, The Rolling Stones, The Beach Boys, or The Supremes.

Casey explains how Nadia got her theme (by Barry Devoreaux & Perry Bodkin, Jr, at number 9).

There is a song in the countdown by the group who has had more of their songs covered by other artists (excepting The Beatles) than any other group in history.

40: I Wish - Stevie Wonder
39: You Are My Starship - Norman Connors
